utterance.content: You're waiting for a bus to Naples?

utterance.speaker: Ina
utterance.content: Comes every 15 minutes. Ben'll be wondering where his dinner is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cab.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bus isn't coming, Ina. But this cab is going to Naples.

utterance.speaker: Ina
utterance.content: Ben'll be getting awfully hungry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We'll tell the cabbie to call the cops. They'll come pick her up, take care of her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Then I'll stay with her until they do.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Find anything?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You've got everybody worried about your quitting.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You here as my boss or my friend?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If I was here as your boss, you'd be suspended by now.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I've learned a lot here. Enough to run my own team. It's time I moved on. Unfortunately, that's how I felt last year. And the year before that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe there's a reason you haven't left. You need structure. And support. Somebody else calling the shots.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You didn't come down here as my boss or my friend. You came down as House. You're trying to insult me into making a decision.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We've both seen it work. Either you rise to the challenge and quit, or you stay. As a team member.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dr. Treiber! Dr. Treiber.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He stopped responding when I was changing his I.V. bag.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Peter, open your eyes. Coma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Treiber's comatose.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: All brains on deck.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Where should we start? We think you might be right.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You couldn't have gone through all of these.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Don't have to. Treiber's reports are thorough to a fault. His methods are fastidious. The answer isn't down here. Treiber didn't miss anything. We did.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So what? Psychosis, abdominal pain, pleural effusions, enlarged heart, coma.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Autoimmune, maybe Goodpasture's.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Kidneys are fine. Vasculitis?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No fever.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lymphoma?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Would've seen it on the heart biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Soap. It's the soap.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, God, here it comes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: As always. All I wanted was some meaningless fun, and I couldn't even last three days.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I had the chance to fulfill a lifelong dream.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I swear, I will jump out of this moving bus if you don't shut up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But instead, I sat with a sad, old woman for 1 1/2 hours who forgot I existed three seconds after she left. And the stupidest thing. I never even had a crush on Julie Christie. In 12th grade I was madly in love with Melanie Robbins, who happened to look exactly like Julie Christie in Dr. Zhivago. And she really liked me. Played spades every lunch period in Mr. Charlton's classroom. But of course, there was this other guy. A great guy. Very popular. He had a car. He had a band, a mustache…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kyle would've ditched that sad, old woman from the bus stop. Probably would've ditched me too. I can live without Kyle. Snowball?

utterance.speaker: Treiber
utterance.content: Guess this isn't heaven.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We found out who screwed up. You. It was your industrial-strength antibacterial soap. The additional triclosan does two things well: Kills MRSA and makes your thyroid look stupid. It thinks the triclosan is a real hormone and closes up shop. Excessive use over time combined with excessive use of this led to hypothyroidism. Which went undiagnosed until it presented with psychosis. When the ER put you on the sedatives, it kicked you into myxedema crisis.

utterance.speaker: Treiber
utterance.content: Don't know that I ever would've thought of that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House told us to look for irony.

utterance.speaker: Treiber
utterance.content: Hey. This wasn't House.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My locker key.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll give you your own team.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Thanks. But it's time to step out of the shadow.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's about time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Any news?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not yet. You come here so I could talk you out of it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I came to say thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's been fun.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fun?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sounded pithier than… "We've shared a variety of situations."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why did you let him go?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Legal loophole. 13th Amendment. Abraham Lincoln may have looked great in that hat, but his labor policies…ß
